content.description:
The leftmost bolted route on Pentathlete Wall (and on all of Sawtooth Ridge) starts with climbing up a relatively easy face to the first bolt, and then tackles a funky pillar through the mid section.  The route gets runout considering the sustained moves through the last 3 bolts of the climb.

Interesting body positions, clips and rests follow on the slab face leading up to the anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a 2 bolt top anchor.

content.description: Start with a few slab moves past two bolts to the base of a crack. Clip a high bolt, take a few deep breaths and do several crack and stemming moves to reach a dirty jug then a nice rail. Move up the arÃªte by smearing and heel hooking to the top jug and clip the two bolt anchor. Short and sweet, a little dirty.

The rightmost route on Pentathlete Wall starts in a dihedral with a fun but bizarre move to lead up to the first bolt.  Climbing eases through the middle section walking up an arete which gets runout, but feels safe.  The route gets interesting again above the fourth bolt, and stays fun until the anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a 2 bolt top anchor shared with Hunchy Bunchy Banana Pants (5.7).

content.description: Climb the Left facing crack in the yellowish corner once above the crack scramble up and left to the shared anchor with Jimmy.
content.location: the crack in the left facing corner just the right of Jimmy
Route to the right of Skimmy. Starts in the corner and goes to its own anchors

content.description:
This is the third bolted route from the right on the Pentathlete Wall, and the leftmost bolt on the pillar that this route shares with Pollo Del Fuego.

To get yourself off the ground, find whatever means necessary.  After that, climbing eases until the fourth bolt, where a blind or reachy move pulls you through the crux.

After this, climbing eases, but is still fun and exciting for the grade.

Fun, and a good warmup.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor, shared with Pollo Del Fuego (5.10a).
